org.xflatdb.xflat

Class ShardsetConfig<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xflatdb.xflat.ShardsetConfig<T>

  • public class ShardsetConfig<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the configuration for a sharded table. A sharded table is one which splits its data up among several files.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <U> ShardsetConfig<U> by(java.lang.String xpathProperty, java.lang.Class<U> propertyClass, IntervalProvider<U> intervalProvider)
      Creates a ShardsetConfig with the minimum configuration necessary for static-range sharding.
      static <U> ShardsetConfig<U> by(org.jdom2.xpath.XPathExpression<?> xpathProperty, java.lang.Class<U> propertyClass, IntervalProvider<U> intervalProvider)
      Creates a ShardsetConfig with the minimum configuration necessary for static-range sharding.
      static <U> ShardsetConfig<U> byId(java.lang.Class<U> idClass, IntervalProvider<U> idIntervalProvider)
      Creates a ShardsetConfig describing a table sharded by ID.
      IntervalProvider<T> getIntervalProvider()
      Gets the interval provider used to choose which shard a row will be placed in.
      java.lang.Class<T> getShardPropertyClass()
      Gets the class to which the string value of the property selected by the shard property selector must be convertible.
      org.jdom2.xpath.XPathExpression<?> getShardPropertySelector()
      Gets the XPath expression that selects a property of a row which determines the shard where the row will be placed.
      boolean isShardedById()
      Gets a flag indicating whether the shard property selector is the XPathQuery.Id expression.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getShardPropertyClass

        public java.lang.Class<T> getShardPropertyClass()
        Gets the class to which the string value of the property selected by the shard property selector must be convertible. The converted value is fed to the Interval Provider to determine the correct shard for a data row.

      • getShardPropertySelector

        public org.jdom2.xpath.XPathExpression<?> getShardPropertySelector()
        Gets the XPath expression that selects a property of a row which determines the shard where the row will be placed.

      • getIntervalProvider

        public IntervalProvider<T> getIntervalProvider()
        Gets the interval provider used to choose which shard a row will be placed in.

      • isShardedById

        public boolean isShardedById()
        Gets a flag indicating whether the shard property selector is the XPathQuery.Id expression.

      • byId

        public static <U> ShardsetConfig<U> byId(java.lang.Class<U> idClass,
                         IntervalProvider<U> idIntervalProvider)
        Creates a ShardsetConfig describing a table sharded by ID. The shard selector will use the XPathQuery.Id expression.
        Type Parameters:
        U - The generic type of the ID property; all objects in the table must have the same property.
        Parameters:
        idClass - The class of the property selected by the xpath expression.
        idIntervalProvider - A IntervalProvider that determines the static ranges for the property, each range will have its own file.
        Returns:
        A new shardset config.

      • by

        public static <U> ShardsetConfig<U> by(java.lang.String xpathProperty,
                       java.lang.Class<U> propertyClass,
                       IntervalProvider<U> intervalProvider)
        Creates a ShardsetConfig with the minimum configuration necessary for static-range sharding. The remainder can be left default or set as desired.
        Type Parameters:
        U - The generic type of the ID property; all objects in the table must have the same property.
        Parameters:
        xpathProperty - An XPath expression selecting a property of the data to shard on.
        propertyClass - The class of the property selected by the xpath expression.
        intervalProvider - A IntervalProvider that determines the static ranges for the property, each range will have its own file.
        Returns:
        A new shardset config.

      • by

        public static <U> ShardsetConfig<U> by(org.jdom2.xpath.XPathExpression<?> xpathProperty,
                       java.lang.Class<U> propertyClass,
                       IntervalProvider<U> intervalProvider)
        Creates a ShardsetConfig with the minimum configuration necessary for static-range sharding. The remainder can be left default or set as desired.
        Type Parameters:
        U - The generic type of the ID property; all objects in the table must have the same property.
        Parameters:
        xpathProperty - An XPath expression selecting a property of the data to shard on.
        propertyClass - The class of the property selected by the xpath expression.
        intervalProvider - An IntervalProvider that determines the static ranges for the property, each range will have its own file.
        Returns:
        A new shardset config.
